definition:
Let $M$ be a smooth manifold. A critical point of a map
$u:M\to{\mathbb{R}}$ at $x\in M$ is called if the Hessian matrix $H_u$
(in any local coordinate system) at $x$ is non-degenerate.

A smooth function $u:M\to{\mathbb{R}}$ is called [*Morse*]{} if all its
critical points are non-degenerate. Morse functions exist on any smooth
manifold, and in fact form an open subset of smooth functions on $M$
(this fact is often phrased “a generic smooth function is Morse”).
